help.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**************************************************************************
00002 $Header: Fri 10-27-2000 9:30:09 pm HvA V2.01 $
00003 
00004 DESC: Help driver for HVA_WIN
00005       Use GENINDEX to create the index file
00006 HIST: 19911127 V00.2 - Generalized page break and end of topic character sequences
00007       19920211 V00.3 - uses LIFO stack to switch between display's   
00008           20001027 V2.01 - Adapted for HVA_WIN
00009 ***************************************************************************/
00010 
00011 /*===========================================================================
00012 
00013   HelpPC text files are simple ASCII files that contain control codes
00014   in column one.   Each file must contain a menu title in the first
00015   line.  The remainder of the file consists of keyed lines and help
00016   text.  Each line must end with a CR/LF pair (standard DOS format) and
00017   shouldn't be longer than 79 characters.   Tabs position the text at
00018   8 character tab positions.  The following is a list of keys and
00019   special characters (keys are found in column 1, special characters
00020   appear in columns 1-80):
00021 
00022    '@'  in column 1 indicates a file title which will appear in
00023         the main topic menu.  This must be the very first line
00024         in the file and has a maximum length of 40 characters
00025         (excluding the '@').
00026    ':'  in column 1 indicates a topic key.  Multiple keys separated
00027         by colons ':' can be entered on the same line.  Single spaces
00028         are allowed in a key, multiple spaces are compressed to single.
00029    '%'  in column 1 indicates a highlighted title line.
00030    '^'  in column 1 indicates a centered highlighted title.
00031    ' '  (space) in column 1 indicates normal text.
00032    '~'  Tilde is used to mark text as a topic link.  Use two
00033         tilde characters to represent an actual tilde in the data.
00034         A word or phrase enclosed between tilde's will become a
00035         topic link for the current topic.
00036    TAB  in column 1 starts text in column 9
00037    any other character in column 1 is truncated
00038 
00039    Limits of the genindex() and help()
00040 
00041    Max items in topic menu:              512
00042    Max topics in index:                 1800
00043    Max size of topic text:             16384 bytes
00044    Max lines of text per topic:          512
00045    Max topic key length:                  20
00046    Max file title length:                 40
00047    Max topic links:                      120
00048    No limit on text file size
00049 
00050 =============================================================================*/
00051 
00052 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00053                         HEADER FILES
00054 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00055 #include <stdio.h>
00056 #include <stdlib.h>

00060 #include "video/v_video.h"
00061 #include "keys.h"
00062 #include "window.h"

00067 static void show_line(WINDOW *w, int linenr, char *s);

00069 static int  filbuf(long offset, int flag);
00070 static int  find_topiclink(int linenr, int n);
00071 static int  push_subject(char *s);
00072 static char *pop_subject(void);
00073 static void display_stack(void);

00077 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00078                         CONSTANTS
00079 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00080 
00081 #define KEY_LEN        25    /* Maximum lenght of a key      */
00082 #define MAX_LINES     512    /* Max no lines in text buffer  */
00083 #define MAXKEY        512    /* Maximum number of topics     */
00084 #define HELP_LINE_LEN  90    /* Maximum lenght of a line     */
00085 
00086 typedef struct    /* topic list structure         */
00087 {
00088   char *key;      /* pointer to :info string      */
00089   long loc;       /* file offset                  */
00090 }
00091 TOPIC;
00092 
00093 typedef struct    /* TOPIC_LINK structure         */
00094 {
00095   char *key;      /* pointer to topic string                              */
00096   int  line;      /* Line of topic link.     Set to -1 for unused entries */
00097   int  pos;       /* Position in line        Set to -1 for unused entries */
00098   int  len;       /* Length of topic string  Set to -1 for unused entries */
00099 }
00100 TOPIC_LINK;
00101 
00102 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00103                         LOCAL VARIABLES
00104 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00105 TOPIC       topic[MAXKEY];          /* topic list                   */
00106 TOPIC_LINK  topic_link[MAXKEY];     /* topic link list              */
00107 char        *topic_txt[MAXKEY];     /* Topic text buffer pointers   */
00108 
00109 static FILE *fp;                    /* stream file pointer          */
00110 
00111 static WINDOW   *wn;                /* window pointer                     */
00112 
00113 static int  initflg = FALSE;        /* init complete flag                 */
00114 static int  startline = 0;          /* first line of textbuffer in window */
00115 static int  height = 0;             /* Hight of the window (no of lines)  */
00116 static int  endline   = 0;          /* Last line on the screen            */
00117 static int  link_selected = 0;      /* Selected topic link                */
00118 static int  no_topics;
00119 static char current_subject[KEY_LEN];
00120 static char *subject = NULL;
00121 static char *topic_key_buffer = NULL;
00122 static char *topic_txt_buffer = NULL;
00123 static char *link_key_buffer  = NULL;
00124 
00125 #define MAX_TOS 25                   /* Dimension of stack        */
00126 static char stack[MAX_TOS][KEY_LEN]; /* stack of MAX_TOS keys     */
00127 static int tos = 0;                  /* top of stack              */
00128 
00129 /*---------------------------------
00130   Subjects to push on the stack:
00131 
00132   startline,
00133   endline,
00134   link_selected,
00135   no_topics
00136 
00137 ---------------------------------*/
00138

00141 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00142                         GLOBAL VARIABLES
00143 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00144 char *default_subject = NULL;
00145 
00146 /*==============================================================================
00147                         START OF FUNCTIONS
00148 ==============================================================================*/

00150 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00151     FUNCTION: push_subject()
00152      PURPOSE: push an item on the stack
00153  DESCRIPTION: LIFO buffer
00154      RETURNS: New top of stack
00155      HISTORY: 920211 V0.1
00156 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00157 static int push_subject(char *s)
00158 {
00159   /*---------------------------------------------
00160     If stack is not full, push data on the stack
00161   -----------------------------------------------*/
00162   if (tos < MAX_TOS)
00163   {
00164     strcpy(stack[tos],s);
00165     tos++;
00166   }
00167   return(tos);
00168 }
00169 
00170 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00171     FUNCTION: pop_subject()
00172      PURPOSE: pop an item from the stack
00173  DESCRIPTION: LIFO buffer
00174      RETURNS: item number
00175      HISTORY: 920211 V0.1
00176 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00177 static char *pop_subject()
00178 {
00179   tos--;
00180   if (tos < 0)
00181   {
00182     /*----------------
00183       Stack is empty
00184     -----------------*/
00185     tos++;
00186     return(NULL);
00187   }
00188   else
00189   {
00190     /*---------------------------------
00191       return contents of top of stack
00192     ----------------------------------*/
00193     return(stack[tos]);
00194   }
00195 }
00196 
00197 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00198    FUNCTION: init_help(char *help_file_name)
00199     PURPOSE: Will initialize help functions and parameters
00200  DESRIPTION: Initializing will be done by help() function and
00201              includes allocation of memory and building the
00202              topic index table.
00203     RETURNS: TRUE if successfull, FALSE if not
00204     VERSION: 901115 V0.2
00205 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00206 int init_help(char *help_file_name)
00207 {
00208   int i;
00209   char tmpname[30];                   /* temporary filename */
00210   char *ptr;
00211   char line[HELP_LINE_LEN];           /* line buffer                     */
00212 
00213   if (initflg)
00214   {
00215     wn_error("Help system for %s already initialized",*help_file_name);
00216     return(initflg);
00217   }
00218 
00219   /*-----------------------------------------------
00220   | allocate memory for strings in topic key index
00221   | and allocate pointers to it.
00222   ------------------------------------------------*/
00223   topic_key_buffer = calloc(MAXKEY,KEY_LEN);
00224   if (!topic_key_buffer)
00225   {
00226     wn_error("ERROR in allocating TOPIC_KEY_BUFFER");
00227     return(initflg);
00228   }
00229   for(i=0; i<MAXKEY; i++)
00230     topic[i].key = topic_key_buffer + i*KEY_LEN;
00231 
00232   /*--------------------------------------------------
00233     Call exit_help when exiting from the main program
00234   ----------------------------------------------------*/
00235   atexit(exit_help);
00236 
00237   /*-----------------------------------------------------
00238   | Build the topic index table will be build by using
00239   | file 'subject.ndx'. After this the helpfile
00240   | 'subject.hlp' will be opened and left open to use
00241   -------------------------------------------------------*/
00242   strcpy(tmpname,help_file_name);   /* form filename from root */
00243   strcat(tmpname,".ndx");
00244   fp = fopen(tmpname,"r");
00245   if (!fp)                          /* index file cant be found ! */
00246   {
00247     wn_error("Can't find indexfile %s for help functions",tmpname);
00248     return(initflg);
00249   }
00250   i = 0;                                /* read and process key file */
00251   while(fgets(line,HELP_LINE_LEN,fp))   /* build the topic index table */
00252   {
00253     ptr = strchr(line,'\n');        /* Find '\n'        */
00254     if (ptr) *ptr = '\0';           /* And make it '\0' */
00255     strcpy(topic[i].key, line);
00256 
00257     #ifdef DONT_SKIP_THIS
00258 
00259     if(line[0] != ':')              /* ignore all but subjects */
00260       continue;
00261 
00262     #endif
00263 
00264     fgets(line,HELP_LINE_LEN,fp);
00265     topic[i].loc = atol(line);
00266     i++;
00267   }
00268   fclose(fp);                       /* close index file */
00269   strcpy(tmpname, help_file_name);  /* form help file name from root */
00270   strcat(tmpname, ".hlp");          /* open and leave open ! */
00271   fp = fopen(tmpname, "r");
00272   if (!fp)
00273     return(initflg);
00274 
00275   initflg = TRUE;
00276   return(initflg);
00277 
00278 }
00279 
00280 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00281    FUNCTION: help()
00282     PURPOSE: Show help text about 'subject'
00283  DESRIPTION: When the first character of 'subject' is a ':' then
00284              the help text will be displayed.
00285     RETURNS: TRUE if successfull, FALSE if not
00286     VERSION: 901114 V0.1
00287 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00288 int help(char *in_subject)
00289 {
00290   int i;                                  /* scratch integers */
00291   int  topic_found = FALSE;
00292 
00293   if (!initflg)
00294   {
00295     wn_error("HELP system not initialized");
00296     return(FALSE);
00297   }
00298 
00299   wn_log_indent(2);
00300   wn_log("HELP() START ****\n");
00301 
00302   /*------------------------------------------
00303     Allocate memory for topic text buffer
00304     and assign pointer to it.
00305   ------------------------------------------*/
00306   topic_txt_buffer = calloc(MAX_LINES,HELP_LINE_LEN);
00307   if (!topic_txt_buffer)
00308   {
00309     wn_error("ERROR in allocating TOPIC_TXT_BUFFER");
00310     return(FALSE);
00311   }
00312   for(i=0; i<MAX_LINES; i++) /* Assign pointers to each text line*/
00313     topic_txt[i] =  topic_txt_buffer + i*HELP_LINE_LEN;
00314 
00315   /*--------------------------------------------
00316   | allocate memory for topic link key buffer
00317   | and assign pointer to it.
00318   --------------------------------------------*/
00319   link_key_buffer = calloc(MAXKEY,KEY_LEN);
00320   if (!link_key_buffer)
00321   {
00322     wn_error("ERROR in allocating memory for LINK_KEY_BUFFER");
00323     return(FALSE);
00324   }
00325   for(i=0; i<MAXKEY; i++)
00326     topic_link[i].key =  link_key_buffer + i*KEY_LEN;
00327 
00328   /*--------------------------------
00329     Remove leading ':' from subject
00330   ----------------------------------*/
00331   if (in_subject && in_subject[0] == ':')
00332   {
00333     in_subject[0] = ' ';
00334     trimstr(in_subject);
00335   }
00336 
00337   /*--------------------------------------------------------
00338     If no in_subject given, set subject to default subject
00339   ---------------------------------------------------------*/
00340   if (in_subject == NULL || in_subject[0] == '\0')
00341   {
00342     if (default_subject)
00343       in_subject = default_subject;
00344     else {
00345       wn_error("No default subject given");
00346       return(FALSE);
00347     }
00348   }
00349 
00350   strcpy(current_subject,in_subject);
00351 
00352   subject = in_subject;
00353 
00354   wn = wn_open(_SINGLE_LINE,0,0,_cursvar.cols,_cursvar.lines,
00355                _help_text,_help_border);
00356   if (!wn)
00357     return(FALSE);
00358 
00359   height = (wn->y2 - wn->y1) + 1;
00360 
00361   while (TRUE)
00362   {
00363     /*----------------------------
00364       Check if a subject is given
00365     ------------------------------*/
00366     if (subject == NULL)
00367       break;
00368 
00369     /*-----------------------------
00370       Search for key in topic list
00371     -------------------------------*/
00372     i=0;
00373     topic_found = FALSE;
00374     while(i < MAXKEY)
00375     {
00376       trimstr(subject);
00377       trimstr(topic[i].key);
00378       if(!strcmp(subject,topic[i].key))
00379       {
00380         topic_found = TRUE;
00381         break;
00382       }
00383       else i++;
00384     }
00385 
00386     /*---------------------------------------
00387       If key was found, display text of topic
00388     -----------------------------------------*/
00389     if (topic_found)
00390     {
00391       show_topic(topic[i].loc);
00392     }
00393     else
00394     {
00395       /*---------------------------------------
00396         Show that topic text is not available
00397       ----------------------------------------*/
00398       wn_error("Sorry... No help available on subject %s",subject);
00399 
00400       /*-------------------------------------------------
00401         Retrieve last subject from stack. If no subject
00402         is available, then stop this loop
00403       -------------------------------------------------*/
00404       subject = pop_subject();
00405       if (subject)
00406       {
00407         strcpy(current_subject,subject);
00408         subject = current_subject;
00409       }
00410       else      /* No subjects available any more */
00411         break;
00412     }
00413 
00414   }
00415 
00416   /*--------------------
00417     Close help window
00418   ---------------------*/
00419   wn_close(wn);
00420 
00421   /*-------------------------------------
00422     Free allocated memory
00423   ---------------------------------------*/
00424   free(topic_txt_buffer);
00425   free(link_key_buffer);
00426 
00427   wn_log_indent(-2);
00428   wn_log("HELP() END *****\n");
00429 
00430   return(FALSE);
00431 }
00432 
00433 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00434     FUNCTION: find_topiclink()
00435      PURPOSE: Find the link in the topic link list
00436       SYNTAX: static int find_topiclink(int linenr, int n);
00437  DESCRIPTION: int n : return the index of the n'th topic in this line.
00438      RETURNS: the index of the n'th topic in the line.
00439               If no link is found, -1 will be returned.
00440      HISTORY: 920205 V0.1
00441               29-Sep-1992 20:52:42 V0.2 -
00442 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00443 static int find_topiclink(int linenr, int n)
00444 {
00445   int i;
00446   int line;
00447 
00448   /*---------------------------------------
00449     Find the 1st topic in this line
00450   ---------------------------------------*/
00451   i = -1;               /* Reset index */
00452   while (TRUE) {
00453     i++;
00454     line = topic_link[i].line;
00455     if (line > linenr)
00456       return(-1);      /* We are past the wanted line in the list    */
00457     if (line < 0)
00458       return(-1);      /* We ran out of the actual number of topics  */
00459     else if (i >= MAXKEY)
00460       return(-1);      /* We ran out of the maximum number of topics */
00461     else if (line == linenr) {
00462       if (n <= 0)
00463         return(i);     /* We found the n'th topic on the line        */
00464       else
00465         n--;
00466     }
00467   }
00468 }
00469 
00470 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00471     FUNCTION: check_screen()
00472      PURPOSE: Check variables for drawing the help screen
00473       SYNTAX: static int check_screen(int *sl, int *el, int no_lines);
00474               int *sl      : pointer to startline
00475               int *el      : pointner to endline
00476               int no_lines : number of help lines for the current topic
00477  DESCRIPTION:
00478      RETURNS: TRUE if screen has to be redrawn,
00479               FALSE if not
00480      HISTORY: 30-Sep-1992 22:19:39 V0.1
00481 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00482 static int check_screen(int *sl, int *el, int no_lines)
00483 {
00484   int redraw = FALSE;
00485 
00486   /*-------------------------------------------------------------
00487     Check on valid start line:
00488     (1) The startline must be at least 0 and
00489         at most MAX_LINES - window height
00490     (2) If there are less textlines then the window height,
00491         the startline number is 0.
00492   ------------------------------------------------------------*/
00493   if (*sl < 0) {
00494     redraw = TRUE;
00495     *sl = 0;
00496   }
00497   if (*sl > (MAX_LINES-height+1)) {
00498     redraw = TRUE;
00499     *sl = MAX_LINES-height+1;
00500   }
00501   if (no_lines > height) {
00502     redraw = TRUE;
00503     *sl = min(*sl,no_lines-height+11);
00504   }
00505   if (no_lines < height) {
00506     redraw = TRUE;
00507     *sl = 0;
00508   }
00509 
00510   /*---------------------------------------------------------
00511     Check on valid end line:
00512     (1) The last line in the window is at
00513         most the number of the startline + the height of
00514         the window.
00515     (2) If there are less textlines then the window height,
00516         the last textline is 'no_lines
00517   ----------------------------------------------------------*/
00518   if (no_lines > height) {
00519     *el = *sl + height - 1;
00520     redraw = TRUE;
00521   }
00522   if (no_lines < height) {
00523     *el = no_lines - 1;
00524     redraw = TRUE;
00525   }
00526 
00527   return(redraw);
00528 
00529 }
00530 
00531 
00532 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00533     FUNCTION: prev_link()
00534      PURPOSE: Find previous link
00535       SYNTAX: int prev_link(int curlink, int maxlink);
00536               int curlink : current link
00537               int maxlink : maximum number of links
00538      RETURNS: previous link found
00539  DESCRIPTION:
00540      HISTORY: 06-Oct-1992 21:26:45 V0.1
00541 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00542 int prev_link(int curlink, int maxlink)
00543 {
00544   maxlink=0;
00545 
00546   if (curlink > 0)
00547     return(curlink-1);
00548   else
00549     return(curlink);
00550 }
00551 
00552 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00553     FUNCTION: next_link()
00554      PURPOSE: Find next link
00555       SYNTAX: int next_link(int curlink, int maxlink);
00556               int curlink : current link
00557               int maxlink : maximum number of links
00558      RETURNS: next link found
00559      HISTORY: 06-Oct-1992 21:26:45 V
00560 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00561 int next_link(int curlink, int maxlink)
00562 {
00563   if (curlink < (maxlink-1))
00564     return(curlink+1);
00565   else
00566     return(curlink);
00567 }
00568 
00569 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00570     FUNCTION: redraw_helpscreen()
00571      PURPOSE: redraw complete help screen
00572       SYNTAX: void redraw_helpscreen(WINDOW *w, int startline, int no_lines);
00573               WINDOW *w    : Pointer to opened help window
00574               int startline: first textbuffer line in window
00575               int no_lines:  number of text lines
00576  DESCRIPTION: -
00577      RETURNS: nothing
00578      HISTORY: 07-Oct-1992 19:24:53 V
00579 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00580 void redraw_helpscreen(WINDOW *w, int startline, int no_lines)
00581 {
00582   int j;
00583 
00584   for(j=0; j<no_lines && j < height; j++) {
00585     show_line(w,startline+j,topic_txt[startline+j]);
00586   }
00587 }
00588 
00589 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00590     FUNCTION: first_link_on_screen()
00591      PURPOSE: Find first link which fits on the screen
00592       SYNTAX: int first_link_on_screen(int sl, int el, int n);
00593               int sl: first textbuffer line in window.
00594               int el: last textbuffer line in window
00595               int ll: line of textbuffer with first link in it
00596               int n : number of topics
00597  DESCRIPTION:
00598      RETURNS: The index of the first link which fits on the screen,
00599               -1 if no link on the screen visible.
00600      HISTORY: 07-Oct-1992 20:42:24 V0.1
00601 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00602 int first_link_on_screen(int sl, int el, int *ll, int n)
00603 {
00604   int i;
00605 
00606   i = 0;
00607   *ll = topic_link[i].line;
00608 
00609   while (i < n && *ll < sl) {
00610     *ll = topic_link[i].line;
00611     if (*ll >= sl && *ll <= el)
00612       return(i);
00613     if (*ll >= el)
00614       return(-1);
00615     i++;
00616   }
00617   return(i-1);
00618 }
00619 
00620 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00621     FUNCTION: last_link_on_screen()
00622      PURPOSE: Find last link which fits on the screen
00623       SYNTAX: int last_link_on_screen(int sl, int el, int n);
00624               int sl: number of first textline on the screen
00625               int el: number of last textline on the screen,
00626               int *ll: linenumber of textbuffer with link found
00627               int n : number of topics
00628  DESCRIPTION: -
00629      RETURNS: The index of the last link which fits on the screen,
00630               -1 if no link on the screen visible.
00631      HISTORY: 07-Oct-1992 20:42:24 V0.1
00632 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00633 int last_link_on_screen(int sl, int el, int *ll, int n)
00634 {
00635   int i;
00636 
00637   i = n-1;
00638   *ll = topic_link[i].line;
00639 
00640   while (i >= 0 && *ll >= 0) {
00641     *ll = topic_link[i].line;
00642     if (*ll <= el && *ll >= sl)         /* Break if within screen      */
00643       return(i);
00644     if (*ll < sl)                       /* Break if past top of screen */
00645       return(-1);
00646     i--;
00647   }
00648   return(-1);
00649 
00650 }
00651 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00652    FUNCTION: show_topic(long offset)
00653     PURPOSE: Show text of current topic
00654  DESRIPTION: The text of the topic will be read and displayed. As a start,
00655              only the first page will be read in and displayed, then the
00656              rest of the text. The links will have a special color, and th
00657              active link will be highlighted.
00658              The following keys will be handeled:
00659                ARROW_UP,
00660                ARROW_DOWN,
00661                PAGE_UP,
00662                PAGE_DOWN,
00663                ARRROW_LEFT,
00664                ARROW_RIGHT,
00665                ENTER,
00666                ESC.
00667 
00668              Reaction on keys:
00669 
00670              ARROW_RIGHT: go to next link on the page. If the link is not
00671                on the page, then rearrange the page, so the next link is
00672                on the top line of the page.
00673 
00674              ARROW_LEFT: go to previous link on the page. If the link is not
00675                on the page, then rearrange the page, so the link is on the
00676                startline of the page.
00677 
00678              PAGE_UP: Go one screen of text back. The selected link will be
00679                the last link on the screen.
00680 
00681              PAGE_DOWN: Go one screen of text ahead. The selected link will
00682                be the first link on the screen.
00683 
00684              ARROW_UP: Scroll the page one line down (back in text). If the
00685                selected link disappears from the screen, the new selected link
00686                will be the last link on the screen.
00687 
00688              ARROW_DOWN: Scroll the page one line up (forward in text). If the
00689                selected link 'disappears' from the screen, the new selected
00690                link will be the first link on the screen.
00691 
00692              ENTER: Go to selected link and display its text
00693 
00694              ESC: return to previous link or exit help if no previous link
00695                exists.
00696 
00697     RETURNS: Nothing
00698     VERSION: 901114 V0.1
00699 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00700 static void show_topic(long offset)
00701 {
00702   /*------------
00703     Variables
00704   ------------*/
00705   int no_lines;                 /* No of lines of topic        */
00706   unsigned int choise;                   /* User input                  */
00707   int flag = 0;                 /* Flag for reading topic text */
00708   int old_link = 0;
00709   int old_linkline;
00710   int linkline;
00711 
00712   /*-------------------
00713     Initializations
00714   -------------------*/
00715   startline = 0;
00716 
00717   link_selected = 0;
00718   old_linkline  = startline;
00719 
00720 
00721   /*------------------------------------
00722     Get first screen of text from topic
00723   ------------------------------------*/
00724   no_lines = filbuf(offset, flag++);
00725 
00726   /*-------------------
00727     Show first screen
00728   --------------------*/
00729   wn_clear(wn);
00730   redraw_helpscreen(wn,startline,no_lines);
00731 
00732   /*----------------
00733     Show the text
00734   ----------------*/
00735   while(TRUE)
00736   {
00737     endline      = startline+height-1;
00738     linkline     = topic_link[link_selected].line;
00739     old_linkline = topic_link[old_link].line;
00740 
00741     /*----------------------------------------
00742       Hide old selected link and show new one
00743     -----------------------------------------*/
00744     /* link is on the same line */
00745     if ((link_selected != old_link) && old_linkline == linkline)
00746       show_line(wn,linkline,topic_txt[linkline]);
00747     else {
00748       if (old_linkline >= startline && old_linkline <= endline)
00749         show_line(wn,old_linkline,topic_txt[old_linkline]);
00750       if (linkline >= startline && linkline <= endline)
00751         show_line(wn,linkline,topic_txt[linkline]);
00752     }
00753 
00754     /*------------------------------------
00755       Read complete text for this topic
00756       (only once, controlled by 'flag'
00757     ------------------------------------*/
00758     no_lines = filbuf(offset, flag++);
00759 
00760     /*----------------------------------------
00761       Wait for valid keypress and react on it
00762     -----------------------------------------*/
00763     choise = waitkey();
00764     wn_log("startline = %d   endline = %d   linkline = %d ",startline,endline,linkline);
00765     wn_log("height = %d no_lines = %d ",height,no_lines);
00766     wn_log("key pressed: %x\n",choise);
00767     switch (choise)
00768     {
00769       case PAGE_UP:
00770         /*---------------------------------------
00771           Scroll the screen 1 page up
00772         ---------------------------------------*/
00773         startline -= height;
00774         endline   -= height;
00775         check_screen(&startline,&endline,no_lines);
00776         redraw_helpscreen(wn,startline,no_lines);
00777         if (linkline > endline) {
00778           link_selected = last_link_on_screen(startline,endline,&linkline,no_topics);
00779           if (linkline >= 0)
00780             show_line(wn,linkline,topic_txt[linkline]);
00781         }
00782         break;
00783 
00784       case PAGE_DOWN:
00785         /*---------------------------------------
00786           Scroll the screen 1 page down
00787         ---------------------------------------*/
00788         startline += height;
00789         endline   += height;
00790         check_screen(&startline,&endline,no_lines);
00791         redraw_helpscreen(wn,startline,no_lines);
00792         if (linkline < startline) {
00793           link_selected = first_link_on_screen(startline,endline,&linkline,no_topics);
00794           if (linkline >= 0)
00795             show_line(wn,linkline,topic_txt[linkline]);
00796         }
00797         break;
00798 
00799       case ARROW_UP:
00800         /*---------------------------------------
00801           Scroll the screen 1 line down
00802         ---------------------------------------*/
00803         if (startline > 0) {
00804           startline--;
00805           endline--;
00806           wn_scroll(wn,-1);
00807           show_line(wn,startline,topic_txt[startline]);
00808         }
00809         /*---------------------------------------
00810           Check if selected link is not
00811           outside the screen. If so, search
00812           for new link and show this line
00813         ---------------------------------------*/
00814         if (linkline >= endline) {
00815           old_link = link_selected;       /* Save old link */
00816           while (linkline >= endline && link_selected > 0) {
00817             link_selected = prev_link(link_selected,no_topics);
00818           }
00819           show_line(wn,linkline,topic_txt[linkline]);
00820         }
00821         break;
00822 
00823       case ARROW_DOWN:
00824         /*---------------------------------------
00825           Scroll the screen 1 line up
00826         ---------------------------------------*/
00827         if (endline < no_lines) {
00828           startline++;
00829           endline++;
00830           wn_scroll(wn,1);
00831           show_line(wn,endline,topic_txt[endline]);
00832         }
00833         if (linkline < startline) {
00834           link_selected = first_link_on_screen(startline,endline,&linkline,no_topics);
00835           if (linkline >= 0)
00836             show_line(wn,linkline,topic_txt[linkline]);
00837         }
00838         break;
00839 
00840       case ARROW_LEFT:
00841         /*---------------------------------------
00842           Goto previous link
00843         ---------------------------------------*/
00844         old_link = link_selected;
00845         link_selected = prev_link(link_selected,no_topics);
00846         linkline = topic_link[link_selected].line;
00847         if (linkline < startline) {
00848           startline = linkline;
00849           redraw_helpscreen(wn,startline,no_lines);
00850         }
00851         break;
00852 
00853       case HT:
00854       case ARROW_RIGHT:
00855         /*---------------------------------------
00856           Goto next link
00857         ---------------------------------------*/
00858         old_link = link_selected;
00859         link_selected = next_link(link_selected,no_topics);
00860         linkline = topic_link[link_selected].line;
00861         if (linkline > endline) {
00862           endline = linkline;
00863           startline = endline - height + 1;
00864           redraw_helpscreen(wn,startline,no_lines);
00865         }
00866         break;
00867 
00868       /*----------------------------------
00869         Get topic key if ENTER is pressed
00870       -----------------------------------*/
00871       case ENTER:
00872         if (no_topics > 0)
00873         {
00874           push_subject(subject);
00875           strcpy(current_subject,topic_link[link_selected].key);
00876           subject = current_subject;
00877         }
00878         return;
00879         break;
00880 
00881       /*---------------
00882         Quit from help
00883       -----------------*/
00884       case ESC_KEY:
00885         subject = pop_subject();
00886         if (subject)
00887         {
00888           strcpy(current_subject,subject);
00889           subject = current_subject;
00890         }
00891         return;
00892         break;
00893     }
00894   }
00895 }
00896 
00897 
00898 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00899    FUNCTION: filbuf()
00900     PURPOSE: Fill text buffer with text from helpfile
00901  DESRIPTION: If flag = 0 then read only first screen of topic
00902              If flag = 1 then read complete topic
00903              If flag > 1 then return immediately
00904     RETURNS: Number of lines on the page
00905     HISTORY: 901114 V0.1
00906              920205 V0.2 - Added flag to speed up reading
00907              28-Sep-1992 21:09:48 V0.3 - Changed algoritme to get tokens
00908 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00909 static int filbuf(long offset, int flag)
00910 {
00911   int    i,j;
00912   static int no_lines;
00913   char   line[HELP_LINE_LEN];  /* line buffer       */
00914   char   token[80];            /* Pointer to token  */
00915   int    pos,len;
00916 
00917   /*-------------------------------
00918     If flag == 1 Return immediately.
00919     The complete text of the topic
00920     has been read already
00921   ---------------------------------*/
00922   if (flag > 1)
00923     return(no_lines);
00924 
00925   /*----------------------
00926     Initialize variables
00927   -----------------------*/
00928   no_lines=0;
00929   no_topics = 0;          /* Number of links in the list */
00930 
00931   /*-----------------------------------
00932     Position file pointer on topic key
00933   -----------------------------------*/
00934   fseek(fp, offset, 0);       /* position file               */
00935 
00936   /*---------------------------------
00937     Read and process the topic text
00938   ----------------------------------*/
00939   do
00940   {
00941     fgets(line, 132, fp);     /* fetch a line              */
00942 
00943     /*-----------------------
00944       Check for end of file
00945     ------------------------*/
00946     if (!strcmp("*END*\n",line))
00947       break;
00948 
00949     /*---------------------------------
00950       Check for start of next topic
00951     -----------------------------------*/
00952     if (line[0] == ':')
00953        break;
00954 
00955     /*----------------------
00956       Check for file title
00957     -----------------------*/
00958     if (line[0] == '@')
00959       break;
00960 
00961     /*----------------------
00962       Strip LF from string
00963     -----------------------*/
00964     len = strlen(line);
00965     line[len-1] = '\0';
00966 
00967     strcpy(topic_txt[no_lines],line);
00968 
00969     /*----------------------------------------------------
00970       Check the line for subtopic links.
00971       If one is found, add this to the subtopic link list
00972     -----------------------------------------------------*/
00973     i = 0;
00974     while (strchr(&line[i],'~')) {
00975       /*---------------------------------------
00976         Extract token from the line
00977       ---------------------------------------*/
00978       while (line[i] && line[i] != '~') i++;     /* Find first '~' */
00979       pos = i;                                   /* Save position  */
00980 
00981       j = 0;
00982       i++;                                       /* Point after first '~' */
00983       while (line[i] && line[i] != '~') token[j++] = line[i++]; /* Extr. token */
00984       token[j] = '\0';                           /* End of string         */
00985       i++;                                       /* Point after 2nd '~'   */
00986 
00987       /*---------------------------------------
00988         Set the topic variables
00989       ---------------------------------------*/
00990       strcpy(topic_link[no_topics].key,token);
00991       topic_link[no_topics].line = no_lines;
00992       topic_link[no_topics].pos  = pos;
00993       len = strlen(token);
00994       topic_link[no_topics].len  = len;
00995       topic_txt[no_lines][pos]       = ' ';   /* 0x10; */       /* Mark begin of link */
00996       topic_txt[no_lines][pos+len+1] = ' ';   /* 0x11; */      /* Mark end of link   */
00997       no_topics++;
00998     }
00999 
01000     no_lines++;
01001 
01002     /*----------------------------------------------
01003       If flag is zero, then check if first screen
01004       is completely read.
01005     ------------------------------------------------*/
01006     if (flag == 0 && no_lines >= height)
01007       break;
01008 
01009   }
01010   while (TRUE);
01011 
01012   /*------------------------------------
01013     Clear remainder of topic text lines
01014   -------------------------------------*/
01015   for (j=no_lines ; j < MAX_LINES ; j++)
01016     topic_txt[j][0] = '\0';
01017 
01018   /*------------------------------------
01019     Clear remainder of topic link list
01020   -------------------------------------*/
01021   for (j=no_topics ; j< MAXKEY ; j++)
01022   {
01023     topic_link[j].key[0] = '\0';
01024     topic_link[j].line   = -1;
01025     topic_link[j].pos    = -1;
01026     topic_link[j].len    = -1;
01027   }
01028 
01029   return(no_lines);
01030 }
01031 
01032 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
01033     FUNCTION: show_line()
01034      PURPOSE: Show a line on a help page
01035       SYNTAX: static void show_line(WINDOW *w, int linenr, char *s);
01036  DESCRIPTION: WINDOW *w : pointer to opened help window
01037               int linenr: linenumber of textbuffer to print in window
01038               char *s   : text to show
01039       GLOBAL: int startline = first line of textbuffer in the window
01040      RETURNS: Nothing
01041      HISTORY: 14-Oct-1993 V0.2 - Now uses a window instead of direct screen...
01042 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01043 static void show_line(WINDOW *w, int linenr, char *s)
01044 {
01045   int  link;
01046   int  i;
01047   int  w_line;        /* Window line number */
01048 
01049   /*-------------------
01050     Initializations
01051   -------------------*/
01052   w_line = linenr - startline;
01053 
01054   /*-------------------------------
01055     Clear the line in the window
01056   -------------------------------*/
01057   wn_fill(w,w_line,0,w->xsize-2,1,' ',_help_text);
01058 
01059   switch(s[0]) {
01060     case '^':       /* Centered, highlighted line */
01061       wn_locate(w,w_line,5);  /* Not centered yet */
01062       wn_printf(w,"%s",s+1);
01063       return;
01064       break;
01065     case '%':       /* Complete highlighted line */
01066       wn_setattrib(w,w_line,0,w->xsize-2,1,_help_bold);
01067       wn_locate(w,w_line,0);
01068       wn_printf(w,"%s",s+1);
01069       return;
01070       break;
01071     default:
01072       if (*s) {
01073         wn_locate(w,w_line,0);
01074         wn_printf(w,"%s",s+1);
01075       }
01076       break;
01077   }
01078 
01079   /*------------------------------------------
01080     Check if this line has a topic link in it
01081   --------------------------------------------*/
01082   i = 0;
01083   link = find_topiclink(linenr,i);
01084   while (link >= 0) {
01085     /*----------------------------------
01086       Set the attributes of a link key
01087     -----------------------------------*/
01088     if (link == link_selected)
01089       wn_setattrib(w,w_line,topic_link[link].pos,topic_link[link].len,1,
01090                 _help_linkselect);
01091     /*------------------------------
01092       Highlight the selected link
01093     ------------------------------*/
01094     else
01095       wn_setattrib(w,w_line,topic_link[link].pos,topic_link[link].len,1,
01096                 _help_topiclink);
01097 
01098     /*---------------------------------
01099       Find the next topic on this line
01100     ----------------------------------*/
01101     i++;
01102     link = find_topiclink(linenr,i);
01103   }
01104 }
01105 
01106 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
01107     FUNCTION: exit_help()
01108      PURPOSE: exit from windowed help function
01109  DESCRIPTION: free allocated memory for topic key buffer
01110      RETURNS: nothing
01111      HISTORY: 920107 V0.1 - Initial version
01112 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01113 void exit_help()
01114 {
01115   free(topic_key_buffer);
01116 }
